question: ただ
sourceMnemonic: The kanji means <kanji>solely</kanji>, and this means <vocabulary>solely</vocabulary>, but also other related things like <vocabulary>only</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>merely</vocabulary>. They're all pretty close, so try to remember a few!
sourceReadingMnemonic: To spice up something you'd describe with words like <vocabulary>only</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>simply</vocabulary> use <reading>Ta da</reading>! (<ja>ただ</ja>) to spice it up. It's like magic! Now it isn't just a gift, it's a TA DA surprise gift.
